Next to the slasher films of the 1970s and 80s, ones about the walking dead were probably the second most popular horror sub-genre in modern times. The success of George A. Romero’s 1968 Night of the Living Dead spawned the full-feature zombie craze in which humans are turned in to flesh-eating ghouls after being bitten by walkers, and led to endless remakes, rip-offs and sequels to Romero’s movies.

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, the crew are found in an area with spikes with feeding tubes going all over the place and several skeletons and bodies half eaten. So what are they going to do next? Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie is pale by comparison to more recent Disney fairy tales, thanks to computer graphics. The biggest mistake to me is that the picture was duplicated and dubbed in other languages, like in many “Ameriphobe” movies, looking like a piece of propaganda. What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is the first of three starring the same character. The film was shot in the Philippines, and it shows with the difference in culture, colors, and thick jungle.
